trans-unit.source: Passed to the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationContractGenerationExtension.GenerateOperation(System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationContractGenerationContext)"></xref> method to enable the modification of an operation contract and its context prior to generating code.

Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationContractGenerationContext> object passed to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationContractGenerationExtension.GenerateOperation%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to modify the code document object model prior to the generation of code.

Typically, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationContractGenerationExtension?displayProperty=fullName> interface is implemented on a custom <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlImportExtension?displayProperty=fullName> implementation that is used to import custom WSDL elements or otherwise modify the code at the service or operation level.
To modify the code at the service level, see <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceContractGenerationExtension?displayProperty=fullName>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationContractGenerationContext"></xref> class using the specified contract generator, contract context, operation description, code type declaration, synchronization method and task method.
The service contract generator that generates the code.
The contract and its generation context.
The operation description for the operation to be generated.
The declaring code type.
The method to be generated.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationContractGenerationContext"></xref> class using the specified contract generator, contract context, operation description, code type declaration, and method.
The service contract generator that generates the code.
The contract and its generation context.
The operation description for the operation to be generated.
The declaring code type.
The synchronization method to be generated.
The task method used.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationContractGenerationContext"></xref> class.
The service contract generator that generates the code.
The contract and its generation context.
The operation description for the operation to be generated.
The declaring code type.
The synchronous method.
The asynchronous begin method.
The asynchronous end method.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationContractGenerationContext"></xref> class using the specified contract generator, contract context, operation description, code type declaration, synchronization method, begin method, end method, and task method.
The service contract generator that generates the code.
The contract and its generation context.
The operation description for the operation to be generated.
The declaring code type.
The synchronization method to be generated.
The asynchronous begin method.
The asynchronous end method.
The task method used.
Gets the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod"></xref> for the asynchronous begin operation.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationContractGenerationContext.BeginMethod%2A> to examine or modify the asynchronous begin method that represents the operation to be generated.
The <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod"></xref> for the asynchronous begin operation.
Returns null if the operation is a synchronous operation.
Gets the code generation context for the service contract.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationContractGenerationContext.Contract%2A> property to obtain the contract generation context for the service contract that contains the operation.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceContractGenerationContext"></xref> for the current operation.
Gets the declaring type for the current operation.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationContractGenerationContext.DeclaringType%2A> property to examine or modify the code type declaration for the current operation.
The declaring type for the current operation.
Gets the asynchronous end operation declaration.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationContractGenerationContext.EndMethod%2A> property to examine or modify the asynchronous end method that models an asynchronous operation.
The asynchronous end operation.
Returns null if the operation is a synchronous operation.
Gets a value that indicates whether asynchronous methods are generated for the current operation.
`true` if the operation is asynchronous; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether a task is generated for the current operation.
`True` if a task is generated for the current operation; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription"></xref> for the current operation.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationContractGenerationContext.Operation%2A> property to examine operation information prior to generating code for that operation.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription"></xref> for the current operation.
Gets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceContractGenerator"></xref> that generates the current operation.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationContractGenerationContext.ServiceContractGenerator%2A> property to examine or modify the object that generates code for the current operation.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceContractGenerator"></xref> that generates the current operation.
Gets the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod"></xref> for the synchronous operation.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationContractGenerationContext.SyncMethod%2A> property to examine or modify the synchronous operation before it is generated.
The <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod"></xref> for the synchronous operation.
Gets the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod"></xref> for the task operation.
The <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeMemberMethod"></xref> for the task operation.
